name: Hotel Telegraaf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My dear wife and I recently spendt an oval weekend at The Telegraaf hotel. This became a very nice stay. Many 5 star hotels can have a good location and serve good food, but, what in my opinion puts The Telegraaf on top, were the positive attitude of all personell we met. This can only happen at a small hotel.
reviews.title: Their staff make the difference!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: One morning, standing at the front desk, I could not avoid to hear that the couple in front of us asked for the route to the Rousalka Memorial. Nadja explained and finished by smiling wide and acting like the statue. What a performance!
reviews.title: Great hotel with comfortable atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also in the Tsjaikovsky restaurant it was so nice to have a small talk with Marisa about other and more important things than the deer fillet (which of course was excellent).
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visit The Telegraf, have a meal in their restaurant and ask for the way to Rousalka ;-)!
reviews.title: Well placed hotel within the Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not have many opportunities to spend my nights in a five star hotel, but this hotel had a quite reasonable price (I paid around € 135 per night for two persons including breakfast). The location is perfect, in the middle of old town Tallinn. The hotel has a very nice atmosphere, feels comfortable and friendly and is a nice place for couples (romantic weekend) or business. Staff is very professional, efficient and friendly and they speak excellent English. I can imagine someone might expect a bit larger room, but for us it was very fine. Decoration, furniture, bed and lighting was all perfect and it is lovely that you have free wifi (as almost everywhere in Estonia). I loved the breakfast and you can order your own style of egg (I am in love with Egg Royal: poached egg on salmon). The spa is pleasant with good decoration. It could be a bit small when it is busy.
reviews.title: Good hotel a short walk from the centre of the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend you stay in the Old Town if visiting Tallinn,and I can't see how you could get any better than staying at Telegraff.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decor throughout is very nice,nice hallways leading to rooms,nice big room doors leading into lovely rooms with big beds and room has air con if needed. Never waited long at reception to be dealt with,lifts were always quick and always a free table at breakfast time with good choice.the hotels restaurant also serves evening meals,didn't use it,but was told by locals that its one of the best restaurants in Tallinn.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location of this hotel is perfect ,not even a 1min walk from the square,right in the old town,cobbled streets,old buildings,loads of character.
reviews.title: Excellent property, service, location, everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Tallinn is someplace that I never would have visited if it wasn't for work,but what a surprise,it's a great city,and I recommend you spend it in this amazing hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is/was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms are beautiful, the decor throughout the hotel superb and the facilities excellent. The staff were friendly professional and attentive. My only regret was we only stayed two nights. If I had known we would have booked for longer. Book in the older part of the building at the front if you can. The rooms have high ceilings and huge windows. Can't wait to get back.
reviews.title: Luxury in fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: a very nice location, the rooms are good but a little smaller than the pictures shown in the web page.
reviews.title: Great location, and nice design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Have stayed here on three separate occasions over the 18 months – the primary reason being for its location in the old town as opposed to alternative ‘business’ Hotels outside this area. There are some small negatives to this decision however the basics are all in place: Decent sized table for working with power points within reach (so many Hotels presume you travel with extension leads!), Wi-Fi access throughout and free! and adequate room lighting (main room only, the bathroom lighting is very poor). However this is not a business Hotel as such and other advantages from a 5* tourist hotel are on offer: Friendly professional staff, character rooms (superior type), excellent food. The Hotel offers a Spa however I did not try this. In general rooms are smaller than average however this is the price paid for a Hotel bang in the middle of the Old Town, rooms do vary in size. Only complaint would be the poor lighting in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Top Class Hotel in old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in March 2012 for 4 nights.
reviews.title: I'm in love!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place. Me and my partner booked in after having seen the reviews. We paid for the cheapest room and tried not to get too excited. But the hotel, and the room, exceeded our expectations. The spa was lovely - the pool isn't huge but this was never a problem.
reviews.title: Tallin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main town hall square is just round the corner - less than 5 minutes walk away. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke brilliant English. The breakfasts were great (including pancakes :) ) Have been recommending the hotel, and the city, to everyone since we got home.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff and Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: A four day stay in this hotel for business proved very rewarding. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed, the public areas well designed and attractively furnished.
reviews.title: Style and convenience at the Telegraaf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house restaurant, based on a Tchaikovsky theme, serves haute cuisine; this while possibly being a little pricey, was immaculately presented and tasty. A string quartet serenaded our dinner.
reviews.title: central luxerious Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The location of hotel in unbeatable, right in the heart of the Old Town, with many sights, bars and eateries within half mile walking distance; many a lot closer that than. Take note that the Old Town has a great atmosphere; the rest of Tallinn has almost none.
reviews.title: 2nd time visit; superb historic hotel; highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are travelling for pleasure I don’t recommend Tallinn as a long stay location, but well worth a long weekend in the summer time, when all the cafes and restaurants bring out their tables and streets are lined with entertainers.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the Telegraaf all the staff spoke good English, they were helpful, courteous and pleasant to deal with. What more could we ask?
reviews.title: Our new favourite place in Tallinn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only 2 nights, but the service was excellent and the room was perfect in old town!
reviews.title: fun trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The bathroom in great with a huge bath, so we took many times a bath!
reviews.title: Seems to be worth 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Sunday evening with the ferry from Helsinki and decided to go out for a dinner that evening and the 2nd evening we would try the Tchaikovsky (hotel restaurant). Tchaikovsky is in with the breakfast very nice, but for dinner it is fine dining and that was not our thing so much! It was nice to experience for once, but the amount of food you get is not much.!
reviews.title: Magical First Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did use the 24 h room service on Monday to Tuesday night, because we came late back and were hungry so we ordered 2 deluxe club sandwiches and they where delicious good, a recommending for everyone who stays there and want to order something on the room!
reviews.title: Perfect location in a charming city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely we will come back here and maybe a bit longer time then!
reviews.title: weekend in Tallinn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very lovely hotel. Had issues with air conditioning but the manager stepped in and changed our accommodation once he was made aware of the situation. Breakfast was very nice. Lobby small for check in but a very nice sitting room to the side. Great location.
reviews.title: Great manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was easy to find following our journey on the airport bus, we got off at Viru square (stop 6 on the 90K bus route) . We were welcomed by friendly reception staff and shown to our room by the porter, we instantly loved the room and knew we had made a good choice.
reviews.title: Affordable luxury in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The facilities were first class and the bed was so comfy.
reviews.title: A perfect choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We visited the spa facilities, sauna, jacuzzi and swimming pool and enjoyed the fact we had it all to ourselves.... be warned the pool is pretty cold.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The Town hall square is literally up the road, 3 mins away and is central to many lovely restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Tallinn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: very good service at this hotel, friendly staff and professional. The hotel room was very nice with very comfortable beds and a special kind of neck pillow which was pleasant for a person with neck problems. The restaurant buffet breakfast was delicious with a various of food, bread and vegetables, fruits. The restaurant was amazing for an evening dining with several complementaries from the chef. Spa was great! Nice swimming pool, jacuzzi and relax area.
reviews.title: a very good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I can highly recommend this hotel. Perfect located in the old town, very close to shopping, sightseeing and other restaurants. And I will look forward to my next visit here :-)
reviews.title: should be # 1
Very good quality hotel with excellent location
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in April 2012 and I have nothing but praise. It is located in the Old Town. It is a 2 minute walk to the Town Hall Square. The oldest Apothecary in continuous use is a 1 minute walk. Across the street are 3 excellent Italian restaurants and in the hotel itself, the Tchaikovsky Restaurant was just voted best restaurant in Talinn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I had was a good size. I loved the antique mirrors. Something I've never seen in any other hotel was a "service closet" - a closet that can be opened from the hallway and inside your room. You can put your room service tray here instead of leaving it on the floor outside the door like other hotels. You can also put clothes that need to be laundered here,
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect location in the heart of the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was impeccable - for the hotel and the restaurant. Everyone, from the receptionists to the porters, waitresses to housekeeping - they were all very helpful.
reviews.title: confortable rooms in the center of old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thie is a wonderful hotel right n the historic center of Tallinn. There are 2 separate sections to the hotel with a new build attached to the original post Office. We stayed in the old building and had very good rooms on the 3rd floor overlooking the street. Massive windows let in lots of light and the rooms are a really good size. The only fault I would point out would be that although the rooms have shutters on the windows the rooms are really very bright - not great if you want to sleep in! The breakfast/dining room is very well set out and the choice for breakfast was very good, with cheeses, hams, cereals hot food etc set out in a buffet as well as having a menu that you can choose from giving choices such as pancakes and eggs benedict. You can also pour yourself a bucks fizz. My original choice was the 3 Sisters hotel, but after going to see it when we stayed in Tallinn, i was so glad we chose the Telegraaf not least because of the positioning in the centre. The staff were very welcoming and only to happy to please. All in all a great stay!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, perfectly positioned!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed in hotel Telegraaf as a part of our honeymoon. We have had an unforgettable time enjoying every minute of our stay. The staff could not really be more nice and friendly making us feel relaxed and comfortable.
reviews.title: Telegraaf in May
Excellent
reviews.text: Our room has exceeded my expectations; airy, nice, comfortable and completely sound proof. We were pleasantly surprised by complementary champagne and strawberry on arrival. We have visited the SPA facilities and enjoyed our time there as well, special thanks to Olga:)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was just exceptional; you don’t really want to leave the restaurant before you try everything:)
reviews.title: Outstanding place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend the hotel for both business and leisure and of cause for honeymooners.
reviews.title: Our new winter tradition!

description: Our building, constructed in 1878 and once an exchange station for the Estonian Telegraph company, has been transformed into a unique five-star hotel. Join us and become part of the ambience which has surrounded today's Telegraaf for well over a century.Spend an afternoon in our Elemis day spa, followed by a symphony of Russian cuisine in our restaurant, Tchaikovsky. The only hotel in the Old Town with underground parking, we encourage you to arrive comfortably in one of the most beautiful and stylish cities in Northern Europe.
